"Now let the oxygen fall."
Rowan watched as the oxygen fell with a loud bang. She flinched, forgetting there was a forcefield protecting her, but when she looked up, nothing had happened. The oxygen was still in one piece. literal tree13-Apr-20 01:19 PM

literal tree13-Apr-20 02:50 PM
After a few minutes, she regained her strength and did a few more tests on the oxygen, concluding that a 50cm^2 sheet of metal oxygen shatters from a height of 5 metres when its thickness is 3mm or less. She wrote down her findings.
Rowan wanted to figure out a way to keep a chunk of solid metallic oxygen the way it is without a forcefield to maintain the pressure and cold so she tried combining various elements with it, failing each time. Finally, she added a thin coating of NaCl, and, when she turned off the pressure and cold inside the forcefield, the oxygen stayed as it was.(edited)
Rowan pumped her fist in the air. "YES!!! I DID IT!!!" She looked around anxiously, but wiped her brow when she realised no one was there.

There was a correspondence between the samples unknown liquid that were found in the H20, the white-transparent liquid in the rats and the blood of Channichthyidae. Although the later was slightly different, obviously. It was similar to the differences one may find between, say, a Chaenocephalus aceratus and Chionodraco rastrospinosus. Also the usual differences between different species in cells, etc. Its structure was not fish-like besides what could be identified as blood with the more-or-less correspondence, closer to an amphibian. In 'dead' state, it seemed they were almost starfish-like as their brain were inactive and were reproducing by budding. The babies rendered the same scans as the adult had, though weaker and less developed.

[D] The computer dinged with the results of the download. There existed quite a lot of information to work through, but the computer had attempted a summary: The planet was called Esta, meaning "form" in the language of its residents-- and its residents were called Qhaveid. Images included depicted a race of two-foot tall bipedal creatures in a riot of colors-- lightly furred, with large, round ears, and beetle-black eyes. The Qhaveid were a highly intelligent race with exceptionally developed technology, and extremely child-like, mischievous personalities. They believed that one day they would ascend from their physical form into an energy form, but after centuries of waiting, they decided to take evolution into their own hands. The device which is emitting strange energy readings is one of several created by the Qhaveid to “jumpstart” their evolutionary development. Though it took several centuries of consistent work, the Qhaveid were ultimately successful in their endeavors, creating machines that would harmonize with their own mental zeta waves. As a collective society, the Qhaveid elected to transform themselves, leaving their physical forms behind and ascending to a non-corporeal plane of energy. However, information collected by the computer suggested that the devices were disabled after the ascension out of concern that too much production of the morphic zeta particles would destabilize their energy forms, dissolving the particles away and effectively killing the Qhaveid. The device currently situated underground in the jungle, emitting massive bursts of morphic zeta particles, will eventually dissolve the spirits of the entire species.
